intro: Dampiera tenuicaulis var. curvula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dampiera, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in well-drained environments. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, showcasing adaptability to various climatic conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
